title: The Vietnam War

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
awardEventDetails.for: Outstanding Writing for a Nonfiction Program

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
awardEventDetails.for: Outstanding Directing for a Documentary/Nonfiction Program

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
awardEventDetails.for: Outstanding Sound Editing for a Nonfiction Program (Single or Multi-Camera)
awardEventDetails.description: Erik Ewers (sound designer/sound effects editor) - Mariusz Glabinski (sound designer/sound effects editor) - Dave Mast (sound designer/sound effects editor) - Jacob Ribicoff (sound designer/sound effects editor) - Ryan Gifford (sound effects editor) - Margaret Shepardson-Legere (sound effects editor) - Ira Spiegel (sound effects editor) - Matt Rigby (dialogue editor) - Marlena Grzaslewicz (dialogue editor) - Dan Korintus (dialogue editor) (For episode: "Episode 6: Things Fall Apart (January 1968-July 1968)".)

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
awardEventDetails.for: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Nonfiction Program (Single or Multi-Camera)
awardEventDetails.description: Dominick Tavella (re-recording mixer) (For episode: "Things Fall Apart (January 1968-July 1968)".)

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee BAFTA TV Award
awardEventDetails.description: Ken Burns - Lynn Novick - Geoffrey C. Ward - Sarah Botstein

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Winner Special Award
awardEventDetails.description: (THE VIETNAM WAR stands as a monument to the complexity of war - rising above party politics by digging beneath stories spun by people in power. Ken Burns and Lynn Novick have created a living document of intensely personal stories from sides once at odds. Veterans, protestors and citizens from both North and South Vietnam unite here to examine wounds inflicted by righteousness and regret, and beg audiences to challenge what they are told today and demand to know why war is ever the answer.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee TCA Award
awardEventDetails.for: Outstanding Achievement in News and Information

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee OFTA Television Award
awardEventDetails.for: Best Writing of a Reality or Non-Fiction Program

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Winner Clarion Award
awardEventDetails.description: Ken Burns - Lynn Novick - Geoffrey C. Ward - Sarah Botstein

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Winner Emmy
awardEventDetails.description: Dang Hoa Ho (researcher) - Salimah El-Amin (researcher) - Mike Welt (researcher)

awardEventDetails.title: 2018 Nominee WGA Award (TV)
awardEventDetails.for: Documentary Script - Other than Current Events

awardsHtml:
5 wins & 10 nominations

Primetime Emmy Awards

2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Writing for a Nonfiction Program
Geoffrey C. Ward (For episode "Episode 8")
2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Directing for a Documentary/Nonfiction Program
Ken Burns - Lynn Novick (For episode "Episode 8")
2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Sound Editing for a Nonfiction Program (Single or Multi-Camera)
Erik Ewers (sound designer/sound effects editor) - Mariusz Glabinski (sound designer/sound effects editor) - Dave Mast (sound designer/sound effects editor) - Jacob Ribicoff (sound designer/sound effects editor) - Ryan Gifford (sound effects editor) - Margaret Shepardson-Legere (sound effects editor) - Ira Spiegel (sound effects editor) - Matt Rigby (dialogue editor) - Marlena Grzaslewicz (dialogue editor) - Dan Korintus (dialogue editor) (For episode: "Episode 6: Things Fall Apart (January 1968-July 1968)".)
2018 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Nonfiction Program (Single or Multi-Camera)
Dominick Tavella (re-recording mixer) (For episode: "Things Fall Apart (January 1968-July 1968)".)

BAFTA Awards

2018 Nominee BAFTA TV Award
Best International
Ken Burns - Lynn Novick - Geoffrey C. Ward - Sarah Botstein

AFI Awards, USA

2018 Winner Special Award
(THE VIETNAM WAR stands as a monument to the complexity of war - rising above party politics by digging beneath stories spun by people in power. Ken Burns and Lynn Novick have created a living document of intensely personal stories from sides once at odds. Veterans, protestors and citizens from both North and South Vietnam unite here to examine wounds inflicted by righteousness and regret, and beg audiences to challenge what they are told today and demand to know why war is ever the answer.)

Directors Guild of America, USA

2018 Nominee DGA Award
Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Documentary
Ken Burns - Lynn Novick

Golden Trailer Awards

2018 Winner Golden Trailer
Most Original Poster

Television Critics Association Awards

2018 Nominee TCA Award
Outstanding Achievement in News and Information

Online Film & Television Association

2018 Nominee OFTA Television Award
Best Writing of a Reality or Non-Fiction Program

Clarion Awards

2018 Winner Clarion Award
Television Documentary Series - National
Ken Burns - Lynn Novick - Geoffrey C. Ward - Sarah Botstein

News & Documentary Emmy Awards

2018 Winner Emmy
Outstanding Research
Dang Hoa Ho (researcher) - Salimah El-Amin (researcher) - Mike Welt (researcher)

Writers Guild of America, USA

2018 Nominee WGA Award (TV)
Documentary Script - Other than Current Events
Geoffrey C. Ward (Episode: "Things Fall Apart (January-June 1968) (2017)")

Critics' Choice Documentary Awards

2017 Winner Critics' Choice Documentary Award

International Documentary Association

2017 Nominee IDA Award
Best Limited Series
Ken Burns (executive producer)
